certificate_name: Processed pet food other than canned pet food

fields.label: Commodity code
fields.hint: You can use the trade tariff search on GOV.UK to find this. This code is between 4 and 10 digits, for example 0308305000
fields.name: commodity_code

fields.label: Net and gross weight of consignment
fields.hint: Provide the number and the units of measurement. For example, 500 kg (528 kg)
fields.name: commodity_weight

fields.label: Intended use of commodity
fields.hint: Select technical use for any use other than feeding of farmed animals (except fur or pet animals) and the production or manufacturing of pet food.
fields.name: commodity_temprature

pages.title: What are the details of the product?

content.header: What are the details of the product?
content.caption: Your products
content.paragraph: Enter the details of the products in the consignment. Use a new record for each product. If there are more than 5 products, enter “see attached schedule” and attach a list at the end of this application.

fields.label: Scientific species name
fields.hint: Enter one of these: Aves, Ruminantia, Suidae, Mammalia other than Ruminantia or Suidae, Pesca, Mollusca, Crustacea, invertebrates other than Mollusca and Crustacea
fields.name: product_name

fields.label: Approval number of the manufacturing plant
fields.name: product_approval_num

pages.title: What is the place of origin?

content.header: What is the place of origin?
content.paragraph: If there is more than one, enter " See attached schedule " and attach a list as a supporting document at the end of this application

fields.label: Approval number of place of origin
fields.name: origin_approval_num

content.paragraph: If you are the exporter, provide your name or business name. If you are an agent representing someone else, provide their name or business name.

pages.title: Where will the consignment be loaded?

content.header: Where will the consignment be loaded?

fields.label: Address of place of loading
fields.hint: Enter the address where the consignment will be loaded onto the final means of transport to the EU
fields.name: address_loading_place

pages.title: How will the consignment be transported?

content.header: How will the consignment be transported?

fields.label: Expected date of departure from the UK
fields.name: transported_date

fields.label: Means of transport to the Border Control Post
fields.name: transported_method

fields.label: Identification of the transport
fields.hint: Provide the flight number, the ship name or vehicle registration number
fields.name: transported_id

fields.label: Transport documents
fields.hint: For example airline bill, bill of lading
fields.name: transported_reference

fields.label: Container and seal numbers
fields.hint: If this is not known at the time of application, leave blank
fields.name: transported_seal

pages.title: Which Border Control Post (BCP) will the consignment arrive at?

content.header: Which Border Control Post (BCP) will the consignment arrive at?
content.paragraph: CYour consignment must be inspected at a BCP in the EU. This is usually the same place as the first port of entry into the EU.

fields.label: Name and identification code of the BCP
fields.hint: You can find this on the European Commission’s approved list of BCPs
fields.name: bip_name_eu

pages.title: Is the destination of your consignment the EU or a third country?

content.header: Is the destination of your consignment the EU or a third country?

pages.title: What is the final destination in the EU of this consignment?

content.header: What is the final destination in the EU of this consignment?
content.paragraph: This is the country where the consignment is delivered following clearance from the BCP. If your consignment is going to a third country, leave blank.

fields.label: ISO code of destination country
fields.hint: This is the 2 digit code according to the ISO 3166 standard. For example, FR, DE.
fields.name: iso_code_third_country

pages.title: What is the destination third country?

content.header: What is the destination third country?
content.paragraph: If the final destination of your consignment is the EU, leave blank

fields.label: ISO code of destination country
fields.hint: This is the 2 digit code according to the ISO 3166 standard. For example, CN, BY, TY
fields.name: iso_code_third_country

pages.title: For consignments transiting EU countries, who is responsible for the consignment when in the EU?

content.header: For consignments transiting EU countries, who is responsible for the consignment when in the EU?
content.paragraph: If the final destination of your consignment is the EU, leave blank

fields.label: Name of person responsible for consignment in the EU
fields.name: consignment_transit_eu_name

fields.label: Address of person responsible for consignment in the EU
fields.name: consignment_transit_eu_address

pages.title: Where will the consignment be stored during transit?

content.header: Where will the consignment be stored during transit?
content.paragraph: If your consignment has a final destination of the EU, leave blank.

fields.label: Will the products in transit be stored in a custom warehouse?
fields.name: final_destination

content.paragraph: Provide details of the person or organisation the consignment will be shipped to, or their representative.

fields.label: Certification region
fields.hint: Select the region in which the certification will take place:
fields.name: certification_place

content.paragraph: If you are the exporter, provide your name or business name. If you are an agent representing someone else, provide their name or business name.

pages.title: What is the origin of the product?

content.header: What is the origin of the product?
content.paragraph: Provide details of the origin of the animals from which the product is derived. These may originate from more than one region. We use this information to help control the spread of disease.

pages.title: What is the planned date of export?

content.header: What is the planned date of export?
content.paragraph: This is the date that the consignment leaves the loading premises. This may not be the same date that it leaves the UK. For block applications, enter the estimated date that the first export is likely to take place
